In Chapter 6, McGarigal writes:


> With the bootstrap, the original data structure is maintained; that is, the individual observation vectors are left intact.

> With the Monte Carlo randomization procedure, the original data structure is destroyed by randomly shuffling some of the data




<div class="questionborder">

### Q1 2 pts.

- Regarding the bootstrap, explain what McGarigal means by:
"...the original data structure is maintained..."

</div>
